result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte L Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance upon release to Extended Supervision shall be due no later than 3/1/2019. Failure to pay wil result in an entry of civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment and/or school.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia for use, manufacture or delivery.
Not to possess more than $250.00 at one time.
Not to pssess more than one cell phone at one time.
Not to have more than one phone number registered in his name at one time.
Not to possess firearm, ammunition, magazine, holster, or body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with Tyluan W. 2/19/85; Ismael H. 9/26/91; Kewan H. 11/19/82; Deandre G. 3/18/87; Franko R. 5/31/87; Leo H. 2/13/86.
To comply with all child support Court orders.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.178, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting. 
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m)(4m).  
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the deendan tcould serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

Defendant Donte L Coleman in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Donte L Coleman in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due no later than 3/1/2019; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 


Conditions of Extended Supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*Defendant to not possess any drug paraphernalia for use, manufacture or delivery.
*Defendant to not possess more than $250.00 at one time.
*Defendant to not possess more than one cell phone at one time. 
*Defendant to not have more than one phone number registered in his name at one time. 
*Defendant to not possess firearm, ammunition, magazine, holster, or body armor.
*Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
*Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
*Seek and maintain full time employment and or school.
*Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
*-No contact with Tyjuan W (2/19/85)
                               Ismael H (9/26/91)
                               Kewan H (11/19/82)
                               DeAndre G (3/18/87)
                               Franko R  (5/31/87)
                               Leo H (2/13/86)

*Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting; Notice & Acknowledgement; 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Donte L Coleman in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Donte L Coleman in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TOU COUNT 2 and 3: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his/her Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff Department, pending sentencing hearing.  

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court by 02-08-2016 by 5:00 pm. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 02-09-2016 at 8:30, branch 17. Court vacated jury trial scheduled for 02-10-2016. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
FILED:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Donte L. Coleman in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Donte L. Coleman in custody. Ron Dague for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Officer Juan Duran Milwaukee Police Department. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Not guilty plea is withdrawn. After substitution is excepted by court, defendant pleads not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
